issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
During testing using Kitchen Sink, the rapid image update test did not respond to click events. The test will log "I WAS CLICKED" in the console and the animation will change. This did not occur.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Build KS with SDK 1.9.0.v20120115231633
2) Navigate to Base UI>Views>Image Views>Image Rapid Update
3) Ensure console is running
4) Click stick figure

Result:
Nothing changes, no console output

Expected:
"I WAS CLICKED" in the console, and the animation changes

Note:
This does not occur with KS and SDK 1.8.0.1
fields.summary: iOS: eventListener - Click event listener not firing
fields.environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.8.201201131907
Mac OS 10.7.2
iPad 2 4.3.5
iPhone 4s 5.0
SDK 1.9.0.v20120115231633

comments.body: Verified fixed with SDK 1.9.0.v20120119131634 on iPhone 4s (5.0.1) and Simulator 5.0
